title: Sherborne acquires voting rights over 5.16 percent in Barclays
text: March 19, 2018 / 7:27 AM / Updated 33 minutes ago Sherborne acquires voting rights over 5.16 percent in Barclays Reuters Staff 2 Min Read LONDON (Reuters) - Barclays ( BARC.L ) said on Monday that entities controlled by activist investor Sherborne ( SIGC.L ) had acquired voting rights of 5.16 percent in the British bank’s issued share capital. FILE PHOTO: The logo of Barclays bank is seen on glass lamps outside of a branch of the bank in the City of London financial district in London September 4, 2017. REUTERS/Toby Melville /File Photo “As with all its shareholders, Barclays will continue to engage with Sherborne, and welcomes them as a shareholder,” Barclays said in a statement after the initial disclosure of the shareholding. Activist investors have become a growing threat for large listed firms as they often use their minority shareholdings to push through major changes in company strategy. Sherborne Investors, which describes itself as a turnaround investment firm on its website, raised 700 million pounds in an initial public offering last year. The firm, led by Edward Bramson, forced British private equity firm Electra ( ELTA.L ) to fire its management team. It was founded in 1986 and is involved in both private and publicly listed investments. Reporting by Dasha Afanasieva; editing by Louise Heavens and Jason Neely
